title: Understanding Antisocial Personality Disorder
text: Antisocial personality disorder is a mental health condition characterized by a long-term pattern of manipulating, exploiting, or violating the rights of others. It is important to understand the age criteria for its diagnosis.

title: Age Criteria for Diagnosis
text: Antisocial personality disorder is not diagnosed in children. Instead, a similar condition called conduct disorder is diagnosed in individuals under $$18$$.

title: Diagnosis Age Limit
text: What is the minimum age for diagnosing antisocial personality disorder?

title: Conduct Disorder vs. Antisocial Personality Disorder
text: Conduct disorder is often diagnosed in children and adolescents who display a pattern of behavior that violates the rights of others or major age-appropriate norms.

title: True or False: Antisocial Personality Disorder Diagnosis
text: Antisocial personality disorder is never diagnosed in children under age eighteen.
